alert.note: Alert for Carlton; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 8:12PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Carlton and St. Louis Counties. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM CDT Tuesday, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Superior, Hermantown, Proctor, Thomson, City of Rice Lake, Irving, Cody, Norton Park, Spirit Valley, Piedmont Heights, Denfeld, Duluth Heights, Morgan Park, Central Hillside, Gary New Duluth, Kenwood, East Hillside, Fond Du Lac, Chester Park and Congdon Park. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
